org.appverse.web.framework.backend.persistence.services.integration

Interface IJPAPersistenceService<T extends AbstractIntegrationBean>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The integration bean type managed by your integration service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BatchNodeRepository
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BatchNodeRepositoryImpl, JPAPersistenceService

    public interface IJPAPersistenceService<T extends AbstractIntegrationBean>
    This is the interface for JPA Persistence services implementations providing support for JPA operations.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void contains(T beanP)
      Performs JPA contains operation

      This methods count the number of T elements

      This method allows you to execute a count passing an IntegrationDataFilter as a parameter.

      This methods allows you to perform any JPA operation providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback object for beans for a count operation.

      This methods count the number of T elements returned by a JPQL query

        int count()
          throws Exception
        This methods count the number of T elements
        Returns:
        int The number of records found
        Throws:
        Exception

      • count

        int count(IntegrationDataFilter filter)
          throws Exception
        This method allows you to execute a count passing an IntegrationDataFilter as a parameter. You can pass an IntegrationPaginatedDataFilter as a parameter in order to perform counts related to remote pagination. The IntegrationDataFilter allows you to apply very simple conditions over beans in order to filter the results to be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        filter -
        Returns:
        int The number of records found
        Throws:
        Exception

      • count

        int count(QueryJpaCallback<T> query)
          throws Exception
        This methods allows you to perform any JPA operation providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback object for beans for a count operation. If you want predefined standard hints, set QueryJPACallback "standardHints" boolean parameter to true.
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception

        Returns:

      • count

        int count(String queryName,
        Object... values)
          throws Exception
        This method allows you to perform counts according to a JPQL query byName and the set of parameters the query requires. Queries byName must be added in your orm.xml file
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception

      • countObjectArray

        int countObjectArray(QueryJpaCallback<Object[]> query)
                     throws Exception
        This methods allows you to perform JPA operation providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback returning the number of objects found. Use this method when you need to return directlyobjects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        int The number of records found
        Throws:
        Exception

      • countObjectArray

        int countObjectArray(String queryString)
                     throws Exception
        This methods allows you to execute a JPQL query returning the number of objects found. Use this method when you need to return directly objects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The JPQL query
        Returns:
        int The number of records found
        Throws:
        Exception

      • countObjectArray

        int countObjectArray(String queryName,
                   Object... values)
                     throws Exception
        This method allows you to perform counts according to a JPQL query byName and the set of parameters the query requires, returning the number of objects found. Queries byName must be added in your orm.xml file. Use this method when you need to return directly objects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values -
        Returns:
        int The number of records found
        Throws:
        Exception

        <U extends ResultIntegrationBean> int countResultType(QueryJpaCallback<U> query)

If you want predefined standard hints, set QueryJPACallback "standardHints" boolean parameter to true. Use this method when you need to count IntegrationBeans that does not match the type of the managed objects of your repository

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(IntegrationDataFilter filter)
                                           throws Exception
        This method allows you retrieve a bean passing an IntegrationDataFilter as a parameter. You can pass an IntegrationPaginatedDataFilter as a parameter in order to perform counts when you have to remote pagination. Besides, the IntegrationDataFilter allows you to apply very simple conditions over beans in order to filter the results to be retrieved. Use this method when your query has to return always a result (and just one result). In other case use retrieveAll returning a List. If no results are found or non unique, a exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        filter -
        Returns:
        The T bean retrieved
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.NoResultException - if there is no result
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if more than one result
        Exception

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(long pk)
                                           throws Exception
        Retrieves a bean using its primary key
        Parameters:
        pk - The bean primary key
        Returns:
        T The T bean retrieved
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(QueryJpaCallback<T> query)
                                           throws Exception
        This methods allows you to perform retrieval JPA operations providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback object for beans. If you want predefined standard hints, set QueryJPACallback "standardHints" boolean parameter to true. Use this method when you expect your query to return just one T object. If no results are found or non unique, a exception is thrown
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.NoResultException - if there is no result
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if more than one result
        Exception

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(String queryString)
                                           throws Exception
        Retrieves a bean according to a JPQL query string. Use this method when your query has to return always a result (and just one result). In other case use retrieveAll returning a List. If no results are found or non unique, a exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.NoResultException - if there is no result
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if more than one result
        Exception

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(String queryString,
         Map<String,Object> parameters)
                                           throws Exception
        Retrieves a bean according to a JPQL query string and a map with parameters. Use this method when your query has to return always a result (and just one result). In other case use retrieveAll returning a List. If no results are found or non unique, a exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        queryString -
        parameters -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        javax.persistence.NoResultException - if there is no result
        javax.persistence.NonUniqueResultException - if more than one result
        Exception

      • retrieveList

        List<T> retrieveList(String queryString,
                   Map<String,Object> parameters,
                   int maxRecords,
                   int firstResult)
                                                     throws Exception
        This method allows you to execute a JPQL query returning a List of beans and passing a map of parameters and a maximum number of objects ( beans) and the position of the first object ( bean) of the group of objectes to be retrieved. This method is typically used to perform remote pagination.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The JPQL query
        parameters -
        maxRecords - Maximum number of records ( beans) to be retrieved
        firstResult - Starting position of the first bean of the results to be retrieved
        Returns:
        List List of retrieved beans
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveList

        List<T> retrieveList(String queryName,
                   Object... values)
                                                     throws Exception
        This method allows you to retrieve objects according to a JPQL query byName and the set of parameters the query requires. Queries byName must be added in your orm.xml file
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values - The set of parameters the query requires
        Returns:
        List The list containing all the objects your JPQL query retrieves.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveObjectArrayList

        List<Object[]> retrieveObjectArrayList(QueryJpaCallback<Object[]> query)
                                       throws Exception
        This methods allows you to perform any JPA operation providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback returning . Use this method when you need to return directly objects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        List The list of non typed data to be retrieved
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveObjectArrayList

        List<Object[]> retrieveObjectArrayList(String queryString)
                                       throws Exception

A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        List The list of non typed data to be retrieved

      • retrieveObjectArrayList

        List<Object[]> retrieveObjectArrayList(String queryString,
                                     Map<String,Object> parameters,
                                     int maxRecords,
                                     int firstResult)
                                       throws Exception
        This method allows you to execute a JPQL query returning a List of passing a map of parameters and a maximum number of objects to be retrieved and the position of the first object of the group of objects to be retrieved. This method is typically used to perform remote pagination. Use this method when you need to return directly objects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The JPQL query
        parameters -
        maxRecords - Maximum number of records ( beans) to be retrieved
        firstResult - Starting position of the first bean of the results to be retrieved
        Returns:
        List List of retrieved beans
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveObjectArrayList

        List<Object[]> retrieveObjectArrayList(String queryName,
                                     Object... values)
                                       throws Exception
        This method allows you to perform counts according to a JPQL query byName and the set of parameters the query requires, returning a List of . Queries byName must be added in your orm.xml file. Use this method when you need to return directly objects that does not match neither the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query nor a "resultType". A typical usage is when you do not want to retrieve a full object or a combination of different attributes of different objects involved in the query or just calculated fields. In summary, use this method when you do not have an IntegrationBean or "resultType" to act as a container of the data returned by the query. In this case you get directly a List with an array of objects including the selected data. Of course, in this case, you are responsible to parse this data to objects so do not use this method if you have an specific object to hold the data.
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values -
        Returns:
        List List of Object[] retrieved
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveResultTypeList

        <U extends ResultIntegrationBean> List<U> retrieveResultTypeList(QueryJpaCallback<U> query)
                                                             throws Exception
        This methods allows you to perform any JPA operation providing direct access to the EntityManager by means a QueryJpaCallback returning beans that extend ResultIntegrationBean. Use this method when you need to return as IntegrationBeans that does not match the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query. You can create your own ResultIntegrationBean just extending this class.
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        List The list of ResultIntegrationBean to retrieve
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveResultTypeList

                                                             throws Exception
        This methods allows you to execute a JPQL query returning a List of beans returning beans that extend ResultIntegrationBean. You can create your own ResultIntegrationBean just extending this class.

      • retrieveResultTypeList

        <U extends ResultIntegrationBean> List<U> retrieveResultTypeList(String queryString,
                                                               Map<String,Object> parameters,
                                                               int maxRecords,
                                                               int firstResult)
                                                             throws Exception
        This method allows you to execute a JPQL query returning a List of beans returning beans that extend ResultIntegrationBean and passing a map of parameters and a maximum number of objects ( ResultIntegrationbeans) and the position of the first object ( ResultIntegrationBean) of the group of objects to be retrieved. Use this method when you need to return as IntegrationBeans that does not match the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query. This method is typically used to perform remote pagination.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The JPQL query
        parameters -
        maxRecords - Maximum number of records ( beans) to be retrieved
        firstResult - Starting position of the first bean of the results to be retrieved
        Returns:
        List List of retrieved beans
        Throws:
        Exception

      • retrieveResultTypeList

        <U extends ResultIntegrationBean> List<U> retrieveResultTypeList(String queryName,
                                                               Object... values)
                                                             throws Exception
        This method allows you to perform counts according to a JPQL query byName and the set of parameters the query requires, returning a List of beans returning beans that extend ResultIntegrationBean. Queries byName must be added in your orm.xml file. Use this method when you need to return as IntegrationBeans that does not match the type of the managed objects of your repository a result of your query.
        Parameters:
        queryName - Name of the query in your orm.xml file
        values -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        Exception
